intro: Lithocarpus dalatensis, commonly known as the Dalat stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, native to Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous tree that can reach heights of up to 20 meters, characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and persistent acorns. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in montane forests. Its seeds are enclosed in a hard, woody shell, typical of the genus Lithocarpus. The tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
